title: [Large-Scale] Origin Theory Development and Application Workshop for Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design concepts and understanding of educational theories
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course where pre-service teachers develop and apply origin theories applicable to language education and solve field-specific problems.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more differences between foundational theories and borrowed theories in instructional design.
Learners can draft an instructional design framework applying foundational theories in language education contexts.
Learners can develop two or more case studies applying foundational theories with peer feedback through PBL-based projects.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
